title: Students in Calculus
question_text:
Mr. Charles teaches two different sections of Calculus that contain a variety of students from all grade levels. The following table shows the breakdown by grade level. Which of the following statements is false?
Freshmen Sophomores Juniors Seniors
Section A $13$ $5$ $2$ $1$
Section B $0$ $0$ $3$ $22$
tables:
FreshmenSophomoresJuniorsSeniors
Section A$13$$5$$2$$1$
Section B$0$$0$$3$$22$

choices.text: There are more Seniors in Section B than there are freshmen, sophomores and juniors combined in Section A.
$50$% of Mr. Charles' students are seniors.
There are more students in Section B than in Section A.
About $36$% of Mr. Charles' students are freshmen.
About $11$% of Mr. Charles' students are juniors.
